intro: Hieracium viride subsp. viride, commonly known as the green hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal rosettes of serrated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes.
